name: Ocha-Ken Kururin - Honwaka Puzzle de Hottoshiyo?
name_original: Ocha-Ken Kururin - Honwaka Puzzle de Hottoshiyo?
description:
'Ocha-ken Kururin' (お茶犬くるりん) is a Japanese virtual pet puzzle game released for the Game Boy Advance on October 28th, 2004. Based on a variety of different teas, it originated as a children's toy franchise by (J) SEGA Toys, but has since branched out among Nintendo gaming consoles.

The second entry of the 'Ocha-ken' Game Boy Advance series, the player's main goal is to successfully complete puzzles which are scattered across an 11-episode storyline. After selecting the ocha-pet of choice, the player will begin to work through puzzles of tile-matching style that they encounter throughout the story. The quicker and more cost-effective each puzzle is completed, the grander the prize will be!
